primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes a covenant relationship through acts of salvation, and the people respond by enthroning Him on their praises, transforming duty into delight.

tekstueel_bewijs: It is he that hath made us
He remembered for their sake his covenant
God enabled me to be of assistance

object.identificatie: A life of praise/The Glory of God
tekstueel_bewijs: The purpose of salvation is that we might give him thanks
The meaning of life is grounded in the praise of God

zender.identificatie: God (as the Giver of all things)
tekstueel_bewijs: He is the giver, and we are the recipients
Learning that all these things are gifts from God
We thy people, the flock of thy pasture
Save us... that we may give thanks
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of salvation who becomes the Subject of praise.

helper.identificatie: The Psalms / The Holy Spirit (implied through 'enabling')
tekstueel_bewijs: The Psalms teach us the purpose and goal of praise
God enabled me to be of assistance
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that becomes internal motivation.

tekstueel_bewijs: All references to God had been excised
they were rebellious in their purposes
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad manners, but the 'unfaithfulness' of the people and the 'ether' of a world without God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer (S) keeps the commandments (O) out of gratitude.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Gratitude (the result of the primary program) becomes the fuel for the secondary program of ethics.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → A People for His Praise

voorbeelden: I knew I was supposed to do this — it was my duty
something I wanted to do, not something I had to do
Instead of duty, there is delight
The Psalms teach us the purpose
Learning that all these things are gifts
God enabled me to be of assistance

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon moves the hearer from Devoir (Law) to Vouloir (Gospel) by showing how God's grace changes the heart's motivation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Generic' (Not-S2) to the 'Duty' (Not-S1), then through the 'Iniquity' (S2) which God remembers no more, arriving at 'Gratitude' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God's faithfulness in spite of unfaithfulness (S2) creates the ground for S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; it mentions being 'brought low through iniquity'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects moralism (duty) in favor of a response to God's prior action. God is the primary actor in salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Initial focus on 'art form' of thankfulness
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Being thankful is to some extent an art form.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Subject-switch from human effort to divine gift
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Learning that all these things are gifts from God, and not our own achievement.
The purpose of salvation is that we might give him thanks.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The widow and the friend are used as models, but they are models of *redirection*—turning praise back to God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by focusing on God's delivery of Israel.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Liberation from the burden of 'having to' into the joy of 'wanting to'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is a fruit of justification/gratitude.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'duty' of caring for the widow to the 'delight' of gratitude perfectly mirrors the theological move from Law to Gospel.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'thankfulness as an art form' (skill) and 'thankfulness as a gift' (grace).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Our praise and thanksgiving is actually envisioned as the throne of God.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (implied) provides the 'Pouvoir' (ability) to move from duty to delight.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; described as rebellion and being brought low.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound, placing God as the Sender and Subject of the primary program (Salvation) and the human as the Receiver who then becomes the Subject of the secondary program (Praise).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current balance as it serves the 'Thanksgiving' context well.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Pouvoir' (God's power) is always the source of the 'Vouloir' (our desire).

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent is somewhat external (secular cards).
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Deepen the internal opponent—the 'unthankful heart' that persists even in believers.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To highlight the radical nature of the 'Subject-switch' God performs.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in moving from a human experience (Thanksgiving) to a deep theological structure where God is the primary Subject.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the anecdotes, Greimas reveals that the anecdotes function as 'modal shifts' from Devoir to Vouloir.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Psalm; semiotics shows how the Psalm's structure is being 're-performed' in the lives of the congregation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'widow' story is not just an illustration, but a narrative 'competence' shift that validates the sermon's entire theological claim.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by making the human examples transparent to God's grace.
